biography.bio: Wallace Brennan is an actor, known for Bud's Recruit (1918), Tough Luck Smith (1914) and Marrying Off Dad (1918).
biography.name: Wallace Brennan

biography.bio: Robert Gordon was born on March 3, 1895 in Belleville, Kansas, USA as Robert Gordon Duncan. He was an actor, known for If Women Only Knew (1921), The Mysterious Witness (1923) and Dawn (1919). He was married to Alma Francis and Cissie Cane. He died on October 26, 1971 in Victorville, California, USA.
biography.name: Robert Gordon

biography.bio: Ruth Hampton was born on February 23, 1892 in Nevada, USA. She is an actress, known for The Demand of Dugan (1919), The Case of Bennie (1918) and The Preacher's Son (1918).
biography.name: Ruth Hampton

biography.bio: Thomas Bellamy was born on August 12, 1906 in California, USA. He was an actor, known for The Chocolate of the Gang (1918), The Demand of Dugan (1919) and The Case of Bennie (1918). He died on February 11, 1979 in Los Angeles, California.
biography.name: Thomas Bellamy

biography.bio: Ernest Butterworth Jr. was born on May 8, 1905 in Lancashire, England. He was an actor, known for The Soul of Youth (1920), Three Cheers (1923) and The Yankee Spirit (1923). He died on May 2, 1986 in North Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Ernest Butterworth Jr.

biography.bio: Mildred Davis was born on February 22, 1901 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA as Mildred Hillary Davis. She was an actress, known for Safety Last! (1923), An Eastern Westerner (1920) and Get Out and Get Under (1920). She was married to Harold Lloyd. She died on August 18, 1969 in Santa Monica, California, USA.
biography.name: Mildred Davis

biography.bio: Judge Willis Brown was a producer and writer, known for Bud's Recruit (1918), The Case of Bennie (1918) and The Preacher's Son (1918). He was married to Josephine Folger. He died in October 1931 in Columbus, Ohio, USA.
biography.name: Judge Willis Brown
